unnormalised: **Automotive News: Understanding the Latest Vehicle Launches in India**
normalised: **Automotive News: Understanding the Latest Vehicle Launches in India**

unnormalised: This quarter has seen a flurry of activity in the Indian automotive market, with several exciting vehicle launches catering to diverse consumer needs. Experts at ARAI (Automotive Research Association of India) are keenly observing the impact of these new models on fuel efficiency standards.
normalised: This quarter has seen a flurry of activity in the Indian automotive market, with several exciting vehicle launches catering to diverse consumer needs. Experts at A R A I (Automotive Research Association of India) are keenly observing the impact of these new models on fuel efficiency standards.

unnormalised: Tata Motors unveiled its new electric SUV, the 'Vidyut,' boasting a range of 400 km on a single charge. Dr. Sharma from IIT Delhi commented on its advanced battery technology, stating it could revolutionize EV adoption in tier-2 cities.
normalised: Tata Motors unveiled its new electric S U V, the 'Vidyut,' boasting a range of four hundred kilometer on a single charge. Doctor Sharma from I I T Delhi commented on its advanced battery technology, stating it could revolutionize E V adoption in tier-two cities.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki launched the upgraded 'Alto 800 Plus,' featuring enhanced safety features and a BS-VI compliant engine, priced competitively at Rs. 4.5 Lakhs. The company aims to capture a larger share of the entry-level hatchback segment.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki launched the upgraded 'Alto eight hundred Plus,' featuring enhanced safety features and a B S-V I compliant engine, priced competitively at rupee four point five lakhs. The company aims to capture a larger share of the entry-level hatchback segment.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Mahindra & Mahindra is expanding its footprint in the commercial vehicle sector with the 'Jeeto Plus CNG,' designed for intra-city transportation with a larger cargo area of 80 sq ft. Industry analysts predict these launches will spur growth in the automotive sector, especially as the festive season approaches. Keep an eye on upcoming reviews and comparisons!
normalised: Meanwhile, Mahindra and Mahindra is expanding its footprint in the commercial vehicle sector with the 'Jeeto Plus C N G,' designed for intra-city transportation with a larger cargo area of eight zero square feet. Industry analysts predict these launches will spur growth in the automotive sector, especially as the festive season approaches. Keep an eye on upcoming reviews and comparisons!
